intro.description:
These steps tell you how to execute the test.
Because this test will run locally, do not move the mouse during the test.

item.title: Start the Test Suite
item.description: Start the Test Suite using the button in the running AUT's view or in the Test Suite Browser.

subitem.label: In the prompt dialogs, choose to switch to the execution perspective and opt to make the test run relevant. When the test starts, do not move the mouse. Wait until the test has finished until carrying on.

item.title: Analyze the results
item.description: Look in the results view for information on the test execution.

subitem.label: If you used the data set 17,4,21 then you will see that the "Check result" step for this data set was unsuccessful. Click on the failed step to see information in the Properties View and the Image View.
Switch to the Reporting Perspective using the buttons on the top right of the toolbar.
In the Test Result Summary View, find your test run and double click it to reopen the Test Result View. This lets you see test runs even if they were started by e.g. the Test Executor.
